question_text: Which of the following are examples of cloud elasticity? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Automatically deploying more instances during peak usage
Reducing the number of virtual machines during off-hours
Expanding to new regions for global reach
Maintaining multiple tenants on the same infrastructure
Manually provisioning hardware to meet traffic needs
correct_answer: Automatically deploying more instances during peak usage
Reducing the number of virtual machines during off-hours
explanation: Elasticity refers to dynamic scaling of cloud resources — up or down — based on real-time demand.
